basic_info.description: I'm Reece Calvin. I am a Data Scientist and Economics major at Northeastern University, specializing in creating predictive ML models for strategic decision-making. My expertise lies in baseball analytics, where I apply Bayesian approaches and advanced machine learning techniques to enhance player development and game strategy. I have worked with the Arizona Diamondbacks, Philadelphia Phillies, and Hiroshima Toyo Carp, delivering actionable insights through rigorous data analysis.

projects.title: Hitter Tool Grades
projects.description: Quantified hitter tools using ball tracking data. Evaluated players on Power, Swing Decisions, Speed, and Contact. The model, which ensures minimal correlation between grades, was found to be more predictive of next season's results (wRC+) than public metrics like Process+ and wRC+.

projects.title: Markov Chain Lineup Simulator
projects.description: Built a robust baseball lineup simulator using Markov Chains to predict expected outcome distributions for batters and pitchers. The simulator takes into account pitch counts and max runs allowance, offering maximum explainability for decision-making interventions like bunting and base stealing strategies.

projects.title: Pitch Grader
projects.description: Created a baseball pitch grader using a neural network to grade pitches based on movement and velocity. Initially an independent project, it was adopted by the Hiroshima Toyo Carp to assist in determining the starting rotation.
